title: Add in-app feedback/change request submission flow

requirements.text: Add a simple “Feedback / Request a change” feature that lets an authenticated user submit a short text request and view their previously submitted requests.

quotes: i want to some changes  in this app

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes an authenticated method to create a feedback/change request with at least: id, message text, createdAt timestamp, and a status field (e.g., open/resolved).
Backend exposes an authenticated query to list the caller’s submitted requests (most recent first).
Frontend Settings page includes a clearly labeled entry (e.g., “Feedback / Request a change”) that navigates to a new Feedback page/screen.
Feedback page contains a textarea + submit button with basic validation (non-empty, reasonable max length) and shows success/error toasts.
Feedback page displays a list of the caller’s submitted requests including created date and status.
All user-facing UI text is in English.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add backend/migration.mo if required for state upgrades.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
No third-party auth providers; authentication remains Internet Identity.
nonGoals: Implementing external ticketing integrations (e.g., Jira, email, Slack).
Anonymous feedback submission (feature must require authentication).
Admin dashboards for managing/resolving feedback (unless already present).
